snippet.title: Mojib-Ribbon: Official Trailer
snippet.description:
This is the Japan-only semi-sequel to Vib Ribbon, a game released in Japan and Europe only. It was made by Masaya Matsuura/ NanaOn-Sha. It follows a similar concept of Vib Ribbon, but uses text files to create kanji based rhythm. You can also (apparently) make your own music in the text file, and share it using the Playstation 2 Online feature, so they can literally play your message. It came out on November 20th, 2003. And like I said, it's only in Japan, so good luck finding/playing it if you live in Europe or the US.

Video is from gamespot.com, it's not my own.
